source_sentence: 爾時佛告大王：「當於爾時，散彈長者於十二年飢儉亢旱供養千聖獨覺，于時帝釋助作功德，來降大雨者，大王！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the king, "At the time, that elder Sandān made offerings to a thousand sages and pratyekbuddhas during twelve years of famine and drought, when Indra helped to produce the merit that sent down the great rain, great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異見，其散彈長者，即我身是。
translation: Don't take it the other way around; that long man who scatters bullets is me.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我於過去，非唯以此布施而證菩提。
translation: In the past, I didn't realize enlightenment simply by making alms.

source_sentence: 勿作異見，由我正信，善根積集善根功德因緣故，更修無量福業，而證無上菩提。」
translation: Don't take it differently; it was because of my right faith and the accumulation of good roots and the merit of virtuous causes that I cultivated measureless meritorious actions and realized unsurpassed enlightenment."

source_sentence: 攝頌曰：　馬王仙作證，　　蛇命鳥王恩，　鸚鵡尾提訶，　　龜蘇二商主。
translation: A summary verse says, "The horse king is an immortal who realizes this, the snake lives as a bird king, the parrot's tail is deha, and the tortoise and the two merchants are lords.

source_sentence: 佛言：「復次大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我求無上菩提故，利益攝受一切有情。
translation: As I seek unsurpassed enlightenment, I'll bring benefit to and accept all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great king, listen closely!

source_sentence: 於《中阿笈摩．僧祇得分藥叉經》中廣說。
translation: It's explained at length in the Yakṣa Sutra of the Central Āgama Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，作一馬王，名婆羅訶，而為利益化諸有情。
translation: "At the time, I created a horse king named Vārāha to bring benefit and transformation to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我求無上菩提故，攝受利益有情之事。
translation: As I seek unsurpassed enlightenment, I'll collect things that will benefit sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great king, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃至古昔，於婆羅痆斯，去城不遠有仙人住，心行慈愍悲念有情。
translation: Even in the distant past, there was an immortal living not far from Vārāṇasī who was compassionate and had sympathy for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 去彼不遠有二農夫，耕墾種植遂共相爭，互為瞋鬪遂即相打。
translation: Not far from there, there were two farmers who plowed and planted together, and they fought each other in an argument.

source_sentence: 俱到仙所，並請為證，一人即往王邊，以事白王。
translation: They both went to the sage's place and asked him to testify, and one of them went to the king and told him about it.

source_sentence: 王即告曰：『汝等相爭，何人證見？』
translation: The king then told them, 'Who witnessed your dispute?'

source_sentence: 白言：『大王！
translation: Baiyan: 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我等二人爭，是誰先過？』
translation: Who will go first in this dispute between us?'

source_sentence: 仙人答：『若依轉輪王法，我為作證；若行別法，我不為證。』
translation: The sage answered, 'If I rely on the wheel-turning king's teaching, I'll realize it; if I practice another teaching, I won't realize it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『如是。』
translation: The king said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 仙人答曰：『此人瞋彼，彼人瞋此。
translation: The sage replied, 'This person is angry with that person, and that person is angry with this person.

source_sentence: 彼既打此，此還打彼。』
translation: After he strikes this, this one strikes him back.'

source_sentence: 王言：『若如是者，二俱合罰。』
translation: The king said, 'If that's the case, then they're both jointly punished.'

source_sentence: 仙人曰：『我先有言：「若依轉輪王法斷事，我以為證；汝若不依，我不為證。」』
translation: The sage said, 'I've said before, 'If you rely on the wheel-turning king's teaching to end things, I'll be your witness; if you don't rely on it, I won't be your witness.'

source_sentence: 時王白言：『大仙！
translation: The king then said, 'Great sage!

source_sentence: 云何作轉輪王法而斷事耶？』
translation: How do you create a Dharma of a wheel-turning king and cut things off?'

source_sentence: 仙人答曰：『大王！
translation: The sage replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 若轉輪王法，除無益事，令住有益。』
translation: Suppose the wheel-turning king's teaching is to remove what's not helpful and make it useful to stay.'

source_sentence: 其王告二人曰：『汝去！
translation: The king told the two of them, 'Go!

source_sentence: 更勿如是。』」
translation: Don't do that again.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時仙人以法作證者，勿作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, sages who realized the Dharma mustn't have had a different view, namely that I myself was this.

source_sentence: 我於過去，雖作證見，依法為證，作真實證。
translation: In the past, even though I did see things as realization, I realized them according to the Dharma and truly realized them.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，積集善根政信故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of those causes and conditions, I accumulated good roots and faith, and then I realized unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 又為求無上菩提故，攝受有情。
translation: "Furthermore, in order to pursue unsurpassed bodhi, he takes in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時在不定聚，捨自身命，饒益一切有情。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva was in an indeterminate group, sacrificing his own life to benefit all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處大叢林中，有師子王於中居止。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a lion king living and staying in a large jungle on one side.

source_sentence: 復有五百商人經過險路，由語聲故，有大蟒蛇驚動睡覺，五百商人悉被蟒蛇圍遶。
translation: Again, five hundred merchants were passing through a dangerous path, and because of the sound of their voices, a large snake startled them to sleep, and all five hundred merchants were surrounded by the snake.

source_sentence: 爾時商人甚大驚怕，發聲號叫求諸天神。
translation: The merchants were then terrified and cried out to the gods.

source_sentence: 其師子王聞此叫聲來至，乃見蟒蛇圍彼商人。
translation: When the lion king heard this shouting, he came and saw the boa surrounded by the merchants.

source_sentence: 去此不遠有少年象，爾時師子即往象邊告言：『此諸商人今被蟒蛇圍遶欲食，汝能捨命救彼商人耶？』
translation: Not far from there was a young elephant. The lion then went to the elephant and told him, 'Now that these merchants are surrounded by boa constrictors and want to eat them, would you sacrifice your life to save them?'

source_sentence: 其象答曰：『欲遣如何？』
translation: The elephant replied, 'What do you want to get rid of?'

source_sentence: 師子答曰：『我須上汝頭上，後脚捉頭，以我雙爪打彼蛇腦。
translation: The lion answered, 'I'll go up on your head, grab your head with my hind legs, and strike that snake's brain with my two claws.

source_sentence: 後之兩足入汝頭中，汝當必死；我打蛇腦，蛇當定死；其蛇口吐毒氣，我亦應死。』
translation: When the latter two feet enter your head, you will surely die; when I strike the snake's brain, it will surely die; and when it exhales poisonous breath, I will also die.'

source_sentence: 象曰：『且為利益拔濟多人，寧顧身命？』
translation: The elephant said, 'Would you rather save your own life than save many people for their own benefit?'

source_sentence: 時師子王昇象頭上，擲身打彼蟒蛇。
translation: The lion king then rose above the elephant's head and threw himself at the snake.

source_sentence: 師子按足，象便命過；打彼蟒蛇，蛇亦即死；由蛇毒氣，師子身亡。
translation: When the lion pressed his foot, the elephant died, and when he struck the snake, the snake also died; because of the snake's venom, the lion died.

source_sentence: 三箇一時並皆捨報，諸商人等遂全身命。
translation: All three were instantly discharged, and the merchants and others were left alive.

source_sentence: 商人欲發，空中諸天告商人曰：『此師子王是賢劫菩薩，今為汝等捨自身命拔救諸人。
translation: When the merchants were about to start, the gods in the sky told the merchants, 'This lion king is a bodhisattva of good eons who now sacrifices his life for you to save others.

source_sentence: 汝等宜應供養菩薩，然後進發。』
translation: It's better for you to make offerings to the bodhisattva before you go ahead and start.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人即以種種供具供養師子王身，遶已而去。」
translation: The merchants then made various offerings to the lion king's body, circled him, and departed."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時師子王者，勿作異觀，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, that lion king, don't look at it differently; it's me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時在傍生趣，能救五百商人，捨自身命，害彼毒蛇。
translation: At the time, I was in an earlier rebirth and was able to save 500 merchants by sacrificing my own life to harm that viper.

source_sentence: 由我慈心攝受有情，功德因緣，積集善根，正信力故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of my kindness in taking in sentient beings, the causes and conditions of my merits, the accumulation of good roots, and the power of right faith, I realized unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處有好叢林。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a nice jungle at one place.

source_sentence: 然有菩薩在不定聚傍生之中作共命鳥，一身兩頭：一名達摩、二名阿達摩。
translation: Still, there was a bodhisattva who was a bird of common life among an indeterminate group of animals, and he had two heads: one named Bodhidharma and the other named Adharma.

source_sentence: 是時達摩食好甘菓，後時阿達摩便食毒果，兩俱悶亂，共相平論。
translation: At the time, Dama was eating good sweet fruit, and then Adama ate poisonous fruit, and they were both distracted and argued with each other.

source_sentence: 一作邪願：『願我所生之處，常共汝為惡友，能為損害。』
translation: One made a wrong vow: 'May I always be born in a place where you're a bad friend and can do harm.'

source_sentence: 二者發願：『願我生生之處，常行慈心，利益汝身。』」
translation: The second made a vow, 'May I always act with kindness where I'm born, to benefit you personally.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the king, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時名達摩者，即我身是。
translation: "At the time, the person named Dāsmā is myself.

source_sentence: 其名阿達摩者，即提婆達多是。
translation: His name is Atharman, which is Devadatta.

source_sentence: 我為慈悲心故，由彼因緣，積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: It's because of my compassionate heart and because of those causes and conditions I've accumulated good roots that I've realized unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方處有好流池。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a place where there was a nice, flowing pond.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時於不定聚作其鳥身，於五百鳥中而為鳥王。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva had created the body of a bird from an indeterminate collection of birds, and among the 500 birds, he became the bird king.

source_sentence: 其中有一老鳥，不能遠求食飲，常食小鳥及諸鳥卵，徐劣而行，既食飽已一足而立。
translation: One of them, an old bird, couldn't find food or drink far away, so it always ate small birds and their eggs and traveled slowly and poorly, standing on one foot after it had eaten its fill.

source_sentence: 時諸小鳥，常被食噉，心大愁苦，共詣王邊，作鳥語聲，白言：『鳥王！
translation: The young birds, which were always being eaten and devoured, became very sad and distressed, and they all went to the king's side, made bird noises, and said, 'King of the birds!

source_sentence: 具說如前，愁悲苦惱。』
translation: I've described it as follows: 'I'm sad, pitiable, and distressed.'

source_sentence: 鳥王即為尋訪斯事，是誰食噉諸鳥子等？
translation: The bird king then inquired about this, "Who is it that eats and eats the sons of birds?

source_sentence: 菩薩雖在惡趣心常無異，如是訪察，乃見老鳥詐劣徐行，在池岸邊翹足而立。
translation: Although the bodhisattva's mind remains the same in a bad destiny, he thus investigates it and sees an old bird walking deceitfully and slowly, standing on its own two feet by the shore of a pond.

source_sentence: 于時鳥王菩薩即便覺知是損害之者，而說頌曰：「『食噉諸鳥卵，　　并餘小鳥等；　　翹足一脚立，　　猶如持戒者。
translation: Even then, the king of birds, the bodhisattva realized that this was a harmful person and spoke a verse, saying, "They eat and bite the eggs of birds and other small birds, and they stand with one foot crossed, just like a person who observes the precepts.

source_sentence: 徐徐而縮脚，　　微劣詐言談；　　曲項嬌為斯，　　必是多姦詐。』
translation: They sluggishly retract their foot, speak weakly and fraudulently, and bend their heads to be coquettish like this, surely they're full of deceit.'

source_sentence: 「爾時老鳥便作是念：『今者鳥王既察知我，我今歸依。』
translation: "The old bird then thought, 'Now that the king of birds has perceived me, I'll take refuge in him.'

source_sentence: 鳥王告曰：『汝可設計，勿令諸鳥知汝怨事。』
translation: The king of the birds told him, 'You may design it so that the birds don't learn of your enmity.'

source_sentence: 老鳥聞已速即逃去。
translation: After hearing this, the old bird quickly fled.

source_sentence: 于時眾鳥安隱無憂。」
translation: The birds then were left in peace and without worry."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時鳥王者，莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, the king of the birds didn't think otherwise, that it was me.

source_sentence: 我為鳥王之時，由能慈攝一切有情。
translation: When I was the king of the birds, I was able to compassionately gather in all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，積集善根正見力故，證得無上正等菩提。
translation: Because of those causes and conditions and the power of right view to accumulate good roots, I realized unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方所叢林之中，菩薩爾時在不定聚作鸚鵡鳥，常解人語。
translation: Once upon a time, in a certain place in a jungle, a bodhisattva was a parrot in an indeterminate group that always understood the words of people.

source_sentence: 然於彼時，婆羅痆斯有王名曰梵德，正紹王位，以法化世。
translation: At the time, however, there was a king of Vārāṇasī named Brahmadatta who was in the process of assuming the position of king and teaching the world through the Dharma.

source_sentence: 而有一鳥欲害鸚鵡，鸚鵡飛投大王手中，告言：『大王！
translation: When a bird tried to harm the parrot, the parrot flew into the king's hand and told him, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 莫非法化世。』
translation: Is it not the Dharma that transforms the world?'

source_sentence: 時王見鳥來投手中，心生憐念，即於鸚鵡邊而受五戒，以法化世，勅群臣曰：『今於一切鳥獸，以無畏施。』」
translation: When the king saw the bird coming, he felt compassion for it, accepted the five precepts at the parrot's side, and taught the world the Dharma, commanding his ministers, 'Now, I'll give fearless charity to all the birds and animals.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「莫作異見。
translation: The Buddha told the king, 'Don't take a different view.'

source_sentence: 爾時鸚鵡，解為人語者，見善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: It was then that the parrot understood that those who speak for people see good roots and realize unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於婆羅痆斯有梵德王，正紹王位。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a Brahmadatta king in Vārāṇasī who was in line to assume the throne.

source_sentence: 去此不遠，有尾提訶國起逆，其梵德王常欲伐彼不臣。
translation: Not far from here, there was the state of Videha that rose up in revolt, and that Brahmadeva king always wanted to conquer their subordinates.

source_sentence: 其梵德王兵眾強盛，其尾提訶國雖兵馬驅勝，而常心行慈悲於梵德王。
translation: Although his army was strong, that country of Videha was outmanned by its soldiers and horses, but it always showed compassion for King Brahmā.

source_sentence: 其梵德王貪愛其國，興舉四兵往擊尾提訶國。
translation: The king of Brahmā loved his country and raised four armies to attack Videha.

source_sentence: 其王聞梵德王四兵欲來，即令掃灑城邑無諸瓦石，懸繒幡花，辨諸飲食。
translation: When the king heard that King Bhadrika's four armies were about to come, he ordered the city to be swept clean of tiles and stones, hung silken banners and flowers, and made sure there was food and drink.

source_sentence: 又勅諸臣等，令城內人民出城預前二十五里，香花迎接，復作百種言詞，讚美王德。
translation: He also ordered his ministers to have the people of the city go out twenty-five miles ahead of him, scatter flowers to greet them, and make a hundred kinds of speeches praising the king's virtue.

source_sentence: 其梵德王聞此事已，瞋心乃息，便作是念：『既逆善言，不相違逆，今可迴軍。』
translation: After hearing this, King Brahmadatta's anger subsided, and he thought, 'Now that I've spoken against goodness and not contradicted it, I can turn back to my army.'

source_sentence: 時尾提訶國群臣等讚梵德王曰：『願王過國，所有軍眾，廣陳設會。』
translation: The ministers of Videha then praised King Brahmā, saying, 'May the king go over to his country and assemble his army in a large gathering.'

source_sentence: 尾提訶王說伽他曰：「『大王受懺摩，　　我當親奉敬；　　諸事隨王作，　　幸賜為親友。』
translation: The king of Videha said to Gata, 'Great king, I will personally honor you for accepting the repentance and do whatever the king wants, and I'm honored to have you as a friend.'

source_sentence: 「爾時梵德王復以伽他答曰：「『由忍得解脫，　　瞋心寂無起；　　為一切能故，　　能勝一切人。』
translation: "King Bhadrika then replied with a reply of kāthā, 'It's because of patience that I'm liberated, that my anger is stilled and doesn't arise, and that it's because of all abilities that I'm able to outshine all people.'

source_sentence: 「爾時二王共為和合，其梵德王即歸本國，尾提訶國一切人民皆悉無畏。」
translation: "The two kings then combined, and King Bhadrika returned to his own country, where all the people of Videha were made fearless.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「爾時尾提國王者，莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, the king of Videha didn't think differently, saying that he was me.

source_sentence: 我為調伏其心，由彼積集正信善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: I've helped to control his mind, and because he has accumulated the good roots of right faith, he's realized unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，菩薩爾時在不定聚，於大海中作一龜王。
translation: Once upon a time, the bodhisattva was in an indeterminate village and became a turtle king in the middle of the ocean.

source_sentence: 復於後時，有五百商人乘船入海，乃被海獸打破船舶。
translation: Then, there were 500 merchants who entered the sea in a boat, and their boat was broken by a sea animal.

source_sentence: 其龜取五百商人置於背上，渡出海中。
translation: The turtle took the five hundred merchants and put them on its back, ferrying them out into the ocean.

source_sentence: 爾時商人皆悉安隱，全其身命。」
translation: The merchants were then all safe and sound, and their lives were spared."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「然於彼時大龜王者，莫作異見，即我身是，為由慈攝有情，由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "But don't take that great turtle king's view differently, for I myself am the one who realized unsurpassed enlightenment because I compassionately included sentient beings and because of those causes and conditions, I correctly believed and accumulated good roots.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，時毘提訶國有五百群臣。
translation: Once upon a time, there were five hundred ministers in the country of Videha.

source_sentence: 其中有二兄弟，最為大臣：兄名蘇斯那、弟名斯那。
translation: Among them were two brothers who were the most prominent ministers: a brother named Susna and a younger brother named Sna.

source_sentence: 其名斯那者，心常好覓人過，無利益心。
translation: His name was Sna, and his mind was always interested in finding fault with others and had no intention of benefiting them.

source_sentence: 其蘇斯那者，於一切時常行利益。
translation: He, Susna, always acts for the benefit of others at all times.

source_sentence: 為由蘇斯那常行利益故，其斯那既無利益，惱亂人民，城中眾俱來白王，說彼所作無利益事。
translation: Because Susna always does what's right, his lack of benefit disturbs the people, and the crowd in the city comes to the king and tells him what he's done that's not beneficial.

source_sentence: 其王即令擯出境外，便往婆羅痆斯城，事梵德王。
translation: The king then caused them to leave the country and go to the city of Vārāṇasī to serve King Brahmā.

source_sentence: 後於異時，其蘇斯那聞弟被擯出境，在婆羅痆斯梵德王所以為臣佐，即白毘提訶王言：『今欲往彼婆羅痆斯看弟，作其和順之事。』
translation: At another time, when Susna heard that his younger brother had been expelled and was serving King Brahmā in Vārāṇasī, he said to King Videha, 'Now, I'd like to go to Vārāṇasī to see my younger brother and work with him to make him agreeable.'

source_sentence: 城中人眾皆生怪愕：『其弟常於兄處作無益事。
translation: The people in the city were surprised, 'His younger brother is always doing useless things in his brother's place.

source_sentence: 其弟王擯出國境，此兄尚於弟處能行饒益，共為和可。』」
translation: When his younger brother the king expels him from his country, that brother is still able to do beneficial things for his younger brother and make things agreeable for him.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「莫作異見，於彼時中，名蘇斯那大臣者，即我身是，常為利益有情。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Don't take it the other way around, for at the time, the minister named Susna was me, and he was always working to benefit sentient beings.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of those causes and conditions, correct faith accumulates good roots, and it's because of that that unsurpassed enlightenment is realized.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔於一方所，有一大城。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a large city at a certain place.

source_sentence: 其城中有二商人居止，將五百乘車載其寶貨，行至曠野險路，具如《中阿笈摩》說。
translation: In that city, there were two merchants living there, carrying 500 carts full of their treasures on a treacherous road through a wilderness, as described in the Middle Lengths Āgama.

source_sentence: 其一商人，已被藥叉噉食。
translation: One of the merchants had been devoured by yakṣas.

source_sentence: 第二商主，平安得出曠野之中。」
translation: The second merchant escaped unharmed into the wilderness."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「其第二商主，平安得出曠野之嶮者，莫作異觀，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "The second merchant who safely escapes the treacherous path through the wilderness must not look at himself differently, for he is me.

source_sentence: 為慈攝有情，由彼因緣，正信積集善根故，而證無上菩提。
translation: It's because he compassionately takes care of sentient beings, and because of those causes and conditions, he correctly believes and accumulates good roots and realizes unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一方所叢林之中，多饒河澗，花菓滋茂。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a place in a forest that had many rivers and streams and where flowers and fruits flourished.

source_sentence: 爾時菩薩在不定聚，作六牙象王，在其林內。
translation: At the time, the bodhisattva was in an indeterminate grouping and became the six-tusked elephant king inside that forest.

source_sentence: 其象王妻名曰拔陀，於母象中為最尊貴。
translation: The elephant king's wife was named Bhadra, who was the most honored of his mother elephants.

source_sentence: 是時象王出群，在於閑僻之處，有別雌象，端正悅意，詣象王處，共為私竊。
translation: When the king left his herd and went into a secluded place, a different female elephant, properly pleased, came to the king and stole from him.

source_sentence: 既為夫婦，甚加憐愛，行住相隨，意不相離，心相繫著。
translation: Since they were husband and wife, they took great pity on each other, followed each other in their walks and dwellings, were not separated from each other in mind, and were mentally attached to each other.

source_sentence: 時拔陀母象，便生嫉妬，即自思念：『作何方計，便我當得殺六牙象王并彼母象？』
translation: Bāṭṭha's mother elephant then became jealous and thought to herself, 'What would be my plan to kill the six-tusked elephant king and his mother elephant?'

source_sentence: 正住思惟，心大嫉妬，無計可得，遂便發願：『願我生生之處，能害二人。』
translation: When he correctly abides in thought, his mind is so jealous that there's no way to get it, so he makes the vow, 'May I be born in a place where I can harm two people.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，於山頂上投身而下，便即命終，生毘提國大夫人腹，而處其胎。
translation: After making this vow, he plunged down from the top of the mountain, and then his life ended when he was born in the womb of the great lady of Videha, where he remained in the womb.

source_sentence: 十月滿已誕生一女，眾相具足，漸漸長大，嫁與隣國梵德大王為第一夫人。
translation: After the tenth month was complete, she gave birth to a daughter with many features who gradually grew up and married the great king Brahmadatta of the neighboring country as his first wife.

source_sentence: 由彼宿業，於六牙象等生大瞋恨，然而夫人有宿命智，即白梵德王言：『於彼方所，有六牙大象，我今要此象牙，願王令取。』
translation: Because of her past actions, she had grown very angry with the six-tusked elephant and others. However, she had knowledge of past lives and told King Brahmā, 'There's a large six-tusked elephant in another place, and I want this elephant's tusk, so I hope the king will allow it to be taken.'

source_sentence: 于時王勅諸城所有獵師皆悉喚集，令取六牙大象。
translation: The king then commanded all the hunters in the city to gather and order them to fetch the six-tusked elephant.

source_sentence: 獵師集已，告曰：『汝等往取象牙將來。』
translation: After the hunters had gathered, he told them, 'Go and fetch the elephant's tusks.'

source_sentence: 時諸獵師，王既勅已，依命即去。
translation: After the king commanded them, the hunters complied and departed.

source_sentence: 其獵師大將告獵人曰：『汝等並散，各歸本業，我獨自往取其象牙。』
translation: The commander of the hunters told the hunters, 'Disperse and return to your original work; I alone will go and get the tusks of those elephants.'

source_sentence: 是時大將即取祭祀之物，并著衣甲毒箭等物，造詣方所。
translation: The general then took the sacrificial offerings, put on his robe and armor, poisoned arrows, and other things, and went to the place where he was headed.

source_sentence: 見彼象王并及母象，二俱別住於閑靜處，各離象群而住，見已遠至遙望。
translation: He saw the elephant king and his mother elephant, both of whom were staying in separate quiet places, each living apart from the herd, and looked away after seeing them.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師身被忍服，覆其弓箭，所有衣甲藏在草中，欲為殺害。
translation: The hunter then was dressed in a robe of patience, covered with his bow and arrows, and had his armor hidden in the grass, intending to kill them.

source_sentence: 爾時母象遙見獵師，即告夫曰：『我等速向餘處，今有人來欲殺我等。』
translation: Seeing the hunter from a distance, the elephant mothers told their husbands, 'Let's quickly go somewhere else; someone is coming now who wants to kill us.'

source_sentence: 象王曰：『其人作何形貌？』
translation: The elephant king said, 'What does that man look like?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『身被忍衣，外現慈相。』
translation: He answered, 'Being clothed in forbearance, it shows an outward sign of kindness.'

source_sentence: 『若如是者，當須無畏。
translation: 'If this is the case, you must be fearless.

source_sentence: 在袈裟中，無不善事。
translation: There's nothing unwholesome to do in a monk's robe.

source_sentence: 此之幢相覆蓋之人，心住慈悲，當須無怖，勿生疑惑。
translation: Someone covered by this banner and whose mind abides in compassion must have no fear and no doubt.

source_sentence: 如月無熱，斯人亦如是。』
translation: As the moon has no heat, so does this person.'

source_sentence: 于時母象及以象王，並無疑惑，隨意遊行。
translation: The mother elephant and her king did not doubt it, and they marched as they pleased.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師既得其便，即放毒箭，射彼象王，中於要處。
translation: Having gotten the best of them, the hunter then released a poisoned arrow and shot the king elephant right in the center.

source_sentence: 母象告曰：『如何乃言著袈裟人無有害心？』
translation: The mother elephant told him, 'How can you say that a person wearing a robe has no harmful thoughts?'

source_sentence: 爾時象王以頌答曰：「『心非生過患，　　亦非衣所作；　　此過由煩惱，　　由心離慈愍。
translation: The elephant king then replied with a verse, "The mind doesn't give rise to faults, and it's not made of clothing; these faults are caused by affliction and result from a mind free of kindness.

source_sentence: 如金裹銅葉，　　入火銅性現；　　患人雖不了，　　智者善能知。
translation: It's like a copper leaf wrapped in gold that's bronze when it enters a fire; although the afflicted person doesn't understand it, a wise person well knows it.

source_sentence: 弓箭人俱毒，　　咸由彼為惡；　　袈裟本寂靜，　　皆悉由心作。』
translation: A bow and arrow, along with the poison of men, are caused by their evil; the robe is originally quiet, but it's all made by the mind.'

source_sentence: 「爾時母象心生瞋恚，告其夫曰：「『我不違君語，　　如君今所說；　　我欲碎斯人，　　節節令其斷。』
translation: "Then the mother elephant became angry at heart and told her husband, 'I won't disobey your words, just as you've said now; I want to crush this person and temperately make him stop.'

source_sentence: 「是時象王聞此語已，生如是念：『作何醫療此煩惱事？
translation: "After hearing these words, the elephant king had this thought, 'What will be the medical treatment for this affliction?'

source_sentence: 若是菩薩婦起怨害心者，此不應也。』
translation: If a bodhisattva woman becomes hostile, she shouldn't be.'

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「『如被多鬼所著心，　　見醫即作非供養；　　醫人見彼常非恨，　　應生如是歡喜心。』
translation: The bodhisattva said, 'Suppose you're attached to the minds of many demons and see a doctor and make unsupportive offerings; the doctor sees that he doesn't hate them and should thus rejoice.'

source_sentence: 「爾時母象聞其菩薩象王所說，默然而住。
translation: "Then the mother elephant heard what the bodhisattva Elephant King told her and waited silently.

source_sentence: 時諸群象詣象王處，便作是念：『勿此母象損害獵師。』
translation: The herd of elephants then went to the king and thought, 'Don't let this mother elephant harm the hunter.'

source_sentence: 若菩薩在傍生趣中，常行菩薩行。
translation: Suppose a bodhisattva is in the destiny of another life and always practices the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 是時象王往獵師邊，以人言音告獵師曰：『汝莫怪畏。』
translation: The elephant king then went to the hunter and addressed him in a human voice, saying, 'Don't be surprised and afraid.'

source_sentence: 恐損獵師，象王以鼻遶取獵師，抱在胸前，又令母象別向餘處，然後告曰：『丈夫！
translation: Fearing that it might harm the hunter, the elephant king wrapped his trunk around the hunter, held him to his chest, and caused the female elephant to move to another place.

source_sentence: 母象已去。
translation: The mother elephant has left.

source_sentence: 汝若須我身上物者，任意取之。』
translation: If you need anything on me, take it as you like.'

source_sentence: 是時獵師心極怪愕：『此乃是人，我非人也。
translation: The hunter then was extremely disturbed, 'This is a human being, and I'm not a human being.

source_sentence: 我是人中象，汝是象中人。
translation: I'm an elephant among men, and you're a man among elephants.

source_sentence: 汝在傍生，有是情智？
translation: You're an animal, but do you have this kind of discernment?'

source_sentence: 我居人類，反無斯慧。』
translation: 'I live among humans, but I don't have this kind of wisdom.'

source_sentence: 悲啼泣淚。
translation: They lament and weep.

source_sentence: 菩薩問曰：『為何啼泣？』
translation: The bodhisattva asked, 'Why are you weeping and wailing?'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『汝已損我。』
translation: The hunter replied, 'You've harmed me.'

source_sentence: 時象王聞已，作是思惟：『我現相救，不曾有損。』
translation: When the elephant king heard this, he thought, 'I've saved him, and I haven't been harmed.'

source_sentence: 復更思惟：『不是雌象而來損耶？』
translation: Again, he thought, 'Wasn't it the female elephant that did this damage?'

source_sentence: 又問獵師曰：『誰損汝耶？』
translation: He also asked the hunter, 'Who harmed you?'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『象王！
translation: The hunter replied, 'King of the elephants!

source_sentence: 汝身有無量功德，無辜加害，即是損我。
translation: You have measureless merit in your body, and to harm it innocently is to harm me.

source_sentence: 汝身被箭所傷，可有治療。
translation: You've been wounded by an arrow, and there's a cure for it.

source_sentence: 我心被射，愚癡無智，難可療治。』
translation: Shot in the heart, I'm foolish and lack knowledge, so it's difficult to treat.'

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「『我今觀察象王行，　　功德廣大猶如海；　　起害之人猶發慈，　　此之菩薩心難得。
translation: He spoke the verse, "Now, I've observed the Elephant King's actions, and his virtue is as vast as the ocean; he still shows compassion for those who harm him, and this is a rare thing in a bodhisattva's mind.

source_sentence: 假說我今身是人，　　了無如是真智覺；　　但有如斯瞋害毒，　　身空無有少功德。
translation: Suppose I were to say that I'm now a human being who understands that there's no true wisdom and awakening like this; but with such harmful poison, my body is empty and lacks little merit.

source_sentence: 莊嚴形貌似人身，　　不如生在傍生趣；　　汝在傍生有人智，　　象王為最象中尊。
translation: Their adorned form resembles a human being, but they might not be born in an evening life; while you're in an evening life, there's human cognition, and the elephant king is the most venerable of elephants.

source_sentence: 不言形貌即成人，　　不以傍生非是人；　　若有人慈功德者，　　彼乃當知即是人。』
translation: You don't say that your form is that of a human being, and you don't think that an animal is not a human being; if someone has the merit of being compassionate, then you should know that they are a human being.'

source_sentence: 「爾時象王告曰：『不勞廣說多言語，不用多述巧言辭。
translation: "It was then that the elephant king told him, 'There's no need to explain it in detail with many words or with clever speech.

source_sentence: 汝今云何箭射我？
translation: Now, what did you shoot at me with that arrow?'

source_sentence: 速說斯事令我知。』
translation: Explain this to me quickly.'

source_sentence: 獵師答曰：『我奉王教，須汝身牙，緣此射之。』
translation: The hunter answered, 'I was instructed by the king that I need your tusks, so I'll shoot them because of this.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『仁所須者，幸時早取。
translation: The elephant king told him, 'Sir, it's a good thing you took what you needed early.

source_sentence: 菩薩為懷，無不捨者，任汝拔牙，將所利益。』
translation: There's nothing that a bodhisattva won't abandon in his arms, so let's allow you to pull out the tusks and use them for your benefit.'

source_sentence: 說伽陀曰：「『利益一切有情等，　　速離漂流生死海；　　常證無上菩提智，　　唯願早入涅槃城。』
translation: Sugata said, 'Benefit all sentient beings and others, quickly escape the ocean of birth and death, always realize the unsurpassed wisdom of enlightenment, and wish to enter the city of nirvāṇa sooner rather than later.'

source_sentence: 「爾時獵師心生羞恥，告象王曰：『我須汝牙。』
translation: "Then the hunter became ashamed and told the elephant king, 'I need your tusks.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『任意拔將。』
translation: The elephant king told him, 'Pull them out at will.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我不能拔。
translation: He replied, 'I can't pull it out.

source_sentence: 若令我拔，願住慈悲，我方能拔；若其不住慈悲之心，正拔之時，手必墮落。』
translation: If I were to pull it, I would abide in compassion, and I would be able to pull it; if I didn't abide in compassion, my hand would fall off while I was pulling it.'

source_sentence: 象王告曰：『若汝不能拔者，我自拔與。』
translation: The elephant king told him, 'If you can't pull it out, I'll pull it out myself.'

source_sentence: 象王曰：『為我牙根入肉深遠。』
translation: The elephant king said, 'It's because the roots of my tusks go deep into my flesh.'

source_sentence: 當拔之時白血流注。
translation: When he pulls it out, white blood will flow down his throat.

source_sentence: 拔已欲與獵師，象王身色鮮白如優曇鉢花，血流遍身，如山雪覆，亦如襇文。
translation: After he pulled it out and wanted to give it to the hunter, the elephant king's body was as white as a Udumbara flower, and his blood flowed all over his body like a mountain covered in snow, as also described in the commentary.

source_sentence: 「爾時象王自心覩見身相如是，恐有退轉，欲堅其心，不令嬈亂。
translation: "Seeing this in his own mind, the elephant king feared that he might retreat and wanted to strengthen his mind so that it wouldn't be disturbed.

source_sentence: 由彼菩薩多習性故，而行其施，豈有退邪？
translation: Would it be possible for a bodhisattva with many habits to practice giving because of that bodhisattva's generosity?

source_sentence: 至於死路，唯歸佛陀。
translation: As for the path to death, it's only for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於彼時中，有種種異相，為空中諸天心得滿足，便生喜悅，現希有事。
translation: At the time, there were various unusual features that satisfied the hearts of the gods in the sky, which gave rise to joy and rare appearances.

source_sentence: 然由象王作是苦行，空中有天而說頌曰：「『我等諸天見，　　象王行苦行；　　當正拔牙時，　　受於無量苦；　　內心猶喜悅，　　必不退菩提。』
translation: Still, when the elephant king was engaged in such austerities, some gods in the sky spoke a verse, saying, 'We gods see that the elephant king is engaged in austerities; when he's pulling out his tusks, he'll experience measureless suffering; yet he's still delighted in his heart, and he surely won't fall back from enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「別有一天而問彼天曰：「『如此拔牙身受苦，　　云何能發趣菩提？
translation: "A different god asked that god, 'How can I aim for enlightenment when I'm suffering from pulling teeth like this?'

source_sentence: 猶如地獄受苦人，　　必不能發慈悲意。』
translation: They're like a person suffering in hell who surely can't muster a compassionate thought.'

source_sentence: 「爾時象王拔牙已，默然而住。
translation: "After pulling out the elephant king's tusks, he waited silently.

source_sentence: 獵師念曰：『云何拔牙，執持而住？
translation: The hunter thought, 'How did he pull out the tusks and hold them in place?'

source_sentence: 欲生悔耶？
translation: Do you want to give rise to repentance?

source_sentence: 不與我耶？』
translation: Not with me?'

source_sentence: 于時象王觀知彼意，即持優曇鉢花白色六牙，引其前足，而以六牙欲捨與之，告曰：『待住少時！
translation: Observing their intentions, the elephant king then took the white six tusks of the udumbara flower, drew them to his front feet, and offered to relinquish them with his six tusks, telling him, 'Wait a little longer!'

source_sentence: 待住少時！
translation: Stay a little longer!

source_sentence: 我今極痛。』
translation: Now, I'm in great pain.'

source_sentence: 象王又作此念：『受者現前，何須久住？
translation: The elephant king then had another thought, 'What's the need to stay long while the recipient is present?'

source_sentence: 如何不施？
translation: How can it not be given?

source_sentence: 本為此牙欲殺於我，今既無牙，何慮餘事。』
translation: It was for this tooth that he wanted to kill me, but now that there's no tooth, why should he think about anything else?'

source_sentence: 告獵師曰：『汝應善聽。』
translation: He told the hunter, 'You should listen well.'

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「『賢首汝應棄惡事，　　所持利劍弓箭物；　　被此袈裟仁者衣，　　我今見此心歡悅。
translation: He said to the hunter, 'Bhagavān, good man, you must abandon that which is evil, that which is held by a sharp sword and a bow and arrow, and that which is covered by this robe of a kind man, for I now rejoice at seeing it.

source_sentence: 或有施淨受亦淨，　　或有施淨受不淨；　　我今觀汝淨應供，　　施者受者二俱淨。』
translation: Sometimes a gift is pure and the recipient is pure, and sometimes a gift is pure and the recipient is impure. Now, I see that you are pure and worthy of offerings, and both the giver and the recipient are pure.'

source_sentence: 「爾時象王見彼被離欲衣，心自喜悅，即與六牙，告曰：「『若實毒箭射我身，　　不生少許瞋恨意；　　此實願速證菩提，　　當救輪迴得解脫。』」
translation: "Seeing him clothed in the garment of freedom from desire, the elephant king rejoiced in his heart and gave him six tusks, telling him, "Suppose a poisoned arrow really shot me in the body and I didn't feel a little bit of anger; I really want to quickly realize enlightenment and be saved from the cycle of rebirth."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the king, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼時六牙大象王者，莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: "That six-tusked elephant king, don't take it differently, for it's me.

source_sentence: 我以慈悲苦行布施故，而由未證菩提。
translation: It's because I compassionately and painstakingly practice generosity that I've yet to realize enlightenment.

source_sentence: 由彼因緣，正見積集善根，而證無上菩提。
translation: Because of those causes and conditions, I correctly saw that I had accumulated good roots and realized unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我曾作兔，捨其身肉，布施與彼仙人之時，廣說應知。
translation: "When I once became a rabbit and gave up my flesh to give to that sage, I explained in detail what you should know.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我於往昔，父母二俱無目，常以肩背負擔，將行供養。
translation: In the past, when my parents were both blind, I always carried a burden on my back and made offerings.

source_sentence: 經無量時，而由未證，廣說應知。
translation: After passing through countless hours, but because I hadn't realized it yet, I'll explain it in detail.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我為利益諸有情故。
translation: "It's for the benefit of sentient beings that I do this.

source_sentence: 大王諦聽！
translation: Great king, listen closely!

source_sentence: 世間邪見，而依俗法，父母將老，或令飢餓、溺在河中、或將入火燒身之事，言得生天。
translation: In the world, people with wrong views rely on conventional principles and say they'll be born in heaven when their parents are about to grow old, when they're hungry, when they're drowned in a river, or when they're about to enter a fire that will burn them.

source_sentence: 我設方法，並令禁斷此非法事，廣說應知。
translation: I've devised a way to stop this unlawful thing, and I've explained it in detail so that you should know about it.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 更有無量因緣，並於《那迦藥叉經》中廣說。
translation: There are countless more causes and conditions, as explained in detail in the Nāgârjuna-sūtra.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: "Great king!

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚，作獼猴王，於五百獼猴中為尊貴。
translation: When the bodhisattva was in the indeterminate group, he became the king of the monkeys and was honored among the 500 monkeys.

source_sentence: 婆羅痆斯被梵德王怕懼之時，我於爾時，捨自身命，救五百獼猴，廣說應知。
translation: When Vārāṇasī was feared by King Brahmā, I sacrificed my own life to save the five hundred monkeys, which I've explained in detail should be understood.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚時，生於雉身，如《雉本生經》中廣說。
translation: When he was in the indeterminate class, the bodhisattva was born in the body of a pheasant, as explained in detail in the Pheasant's Original Life Sutra.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚時，生在象中，如《象本生經》中廣說。
translation: When he was in the indeterminate class, the bodhisattva was born among elephants, as explained in detail in the Elephant's Life Sutra.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚時，生在龍趣，名曰矚波龍子，於《龍本生經》中廣說。
translation: When he was in the indeterminate class, the bodhisattva was born in the destiny of dragons and was called Kumbhâṇḍa-nāga-putra, as explained in detail in the Sutra on the Original Life of Dragons.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 菩薩在不定聚時，作鵝王身，如《鵝本生經》中廣說。」
translation: When the bodhisattva is in the indeterminate class, he takes on the body of a king goose, as explained in detail in the Sutra on the Original Life of the Goose."

source_sentence: 爾時勝光大王白佛言：「大德世尊！
translation: It was then that the great king Vairocana said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於何時初發無上菩提之願？」
translation: When did you first give rise to the vow of unsurpassed enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「乃往古昔無量劫時，有王名曰光明。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Once upon a time in the distant past, there was a king named Brightness.

source_sentence: 其光明王有一象寶，身色鮮白如優鉢花，七支圓滿，形貌端嚴，人所喜見。
translation: That shining king had an elephant treasure with a body as pure white as a superior flower, full of seven limbs, and with an appearance so dignified that people liked to see it.

source_sentence: 時王即勅調象之人：『令調此象，堪乘之時，將來見我。』
translation: The king then commanded the elephant tamer, 'Order this elephant to come see me when it's ready to ride.'

source_sentence: 其調象人受王勅已，即將調教。
translation: After receiving the king's command, the elephant trainer was about to train it.

source_sentence: 既成就已，還詣王所。
translation: When he had finished, he returned to the king's office.

source_sentence: 王即乘象，并調象人，王在後坐，出城遊獵種種禽獸。
translation: The king then rode the elephant, and the elephant trainer, with the king sitting behind him, went out into the city to hunt various animals.

source_sentence: 然而象王聞母象氣，尋香而走。
translation: However, the elephant king heard the mother elephant's breath, searched for the scent, and left.

source_sentence: 王見象走其疾如風，告象師曰：「『我見虛空轉，　　四方上下迴；　　山地如陶輪，　　樹亦空中去。
translation: Seeing the elephant walking as quickly as the wind, the king told the elephant master, "I see space turning, circling up and down in all directions; the mountains and earth are like potter's wheels, and the trees are gone in the air.

source_sentence: 象足不曾移，　　猶如騰空去；　　觀前山走來，　　後山無不動。
translation: The elephant's feet don't ever move, but it's like rising into the air and departing; watch as the mountain ahead walks, and nothing behind it moves.

source_sentence: 須勒象令住，　　極打令其怕；　　象王既未調，　　死生今在即。』
translation: He must stop the elephant and make it stand, and he beats it so badly that it becomes frightened; since the elephant king hasn't been trained, death and birth are imminent.'

source_sentence: 「爾時調象師白王曰：「『我誦大仙所說呪，　　并以鐵鉤鉤極打；　　誦呪鉤打唯加急，　　所用之法皆無益。
translation: "It was then that the elephant trainer said to the king, "I've recited this dhāraṇī taught by the great sage, and I've beaten it with an iron hook; reciting the dhāraṇī and hooking it only increases its urgency, but the methods I use are useless.

source_sentence: 無索無鉤能禁制，　　王知無物何能止；　　貪欲入心無調者，　　欲在心中如掘釘；　　此欲發時甚廣大，　　無有能為止息者。』
translation: Without a cord or hook to restrain it, the king knows there's nothing to stop it; desire enters the mind without an adjuster, and desire in the mind is like digging a nail; when this desire arises, it's so vast that there's no one who can stop it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時調象師作種種法，不能止息而令象迴。
translation: "It was then that the elephant wrangler did various things that couldn't be stopped and caused the elephant to turn around.

source_sentence: 又白王言：『其象走困，願王攀取樹枝，放象隨意。』
translation: He also said to the king, 'The elephant is stranded, so may the king climb a tree branch and release the elephant as he wishes.'

source_sentence: 即逢一樹，王及象師攀枝而住，喻如從死而得再生。
translation: They then came upon a tree, and the king and the elephant master climbed on to it and stayed there, figuratively speaking, like being reborn from the dead.

source_sentence: 王告象師曰：『汝不調此象成就，便即將來與我乘騎。』
translation: The king told the elephant master, 'If you don't train this elephant to achieve success, then you'll ride it with me in the future.'

source_sentence: 白王曰：『我調成就，然為彼象聞雌象氣，貪欲醉故不受言教。
translation: He said to the king, 'I've accomplished my goal of training that elephant, but that elephant heard about the female's energy and became intoxicated with desire, so it didn't accept the teaching.

source_sentence: 其象雖去，思憶本處，至第七日，必還來到。
translation: Even though the elephant left, it will think about where it was and come back on the seventh day.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由見母象，共行欲已，思憶象坊。』
translation: After seeing his mother elephant and sharing her desires, he thought about the elephant's workshop.'

source_sentence: 至第七日，其象還還來。
translation: On the seventh day, the elephant returned.

source_sentence: 時調象人速詣白王。
translation: The elephant trainer then quickly went to the king and told him.

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝教此象，未好成就。』
translation: The king said, 'You taught this elephant, but you haven't done a good job yet.'

source_sentence: 其人白王：『我調象已。』
translation: The man said to the king, 'I've trained the elephant.'

source_sentence: 責曰：『云何調伏？』
translation: He was rebuked, 'What did you do to tame it?'

source_sentence: 白言：『請王驗試，即知虛實。』
translation: He said, 'Please examine it, King, and you'll see whether it's real or not.'

source_sentence: 其調象人，即燒大鐵丸，色赤如火，令象取食；象即詣前，欲取吞食。
translation: The elephant trainer then burned a large iron ball, red in color like fire, and told the elephant to take it and eat it; the elephant then went forward and wanted to take it and swallow it.

source_sentence: 其教象人復白王言：『象若食之，象必不活。』
translation: The elephant trainer then again said to the king, 'If the elephant eats it, it won't live.'

source_sentence: 時王告象師曰：『如斯調伏，當時為迷亂我。』
translation: The king then told the elephant master, 'Thus disciplined, it was meant to confuse me.'

source_sentence: 先白王：『我但調伏其身，不能調心。』
translation: He said to the king, 'I've only disciplined my body, but I can't control my mind.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝頗見有能調心者？』
translation: The king said, 'Don't you see someone who can tame the mind?'

source_sentence: 象師白王言：『有！
translation: The elephant master said to the king, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 唯佛世尊能調身心。
translation: The Bhagavān is the only one who can tame body and mind.

source_sentence: 一切有情欲調其心，由不能調，而皆却退。
translation: All sentient beings want to tame their minds, but because they can't tame them, they all retreat.

source_sentence: 有諸外道修行苦行，貪欲叢林在心而不能拔；亦有捨境離欲貪處，而不堅持，復還退失。
translation: There are non-Buddhists who practice asceticism and can't remove the forest of desire from their minds, and there are those who abandon their objects and leave the realm of desire and greed but don't persevere, and they again retreat.

source_sentence: 阿素落等，及以天人、師子雜獸、龍蛇鳩鴿，乃至飛鵝雜類等，一切含識皆被欲縛，無始已來如輪迴轉。
translation: Asura and others, gods and humans, lion animals, dragons, snakes, doves, and even flying geese and goose species are all bound by desire for all contained consciousnesses, and they have been in a cycle of rebirth since beginningless time.

source_sentence: 少年容貌乃至於老，調伏其心，種種苦行，或有仙人，飡風食菓，皆不調心。
translation: Their youthful appearance and even old age temper their minds with various ascetic practices, and there may be sages who eat fruit and wind but don't temper their minds.

source_sentence: 心雖無相，誰有天人能得自在？
translation: Although the mind has no characteristics, who among gods could attain mastery?

source_sentence: 言大王者，有大威力，諸鬪戰中最能殊勝，亦不調心；唯佛世尊無有貪欲心得自在。』」
translation: That person you call a great king has great authority, is the most superior in fights, and doesn't tame the mind; only the Bhagavān has no craving and attains mastery.'"

source_sentence: 爾時大王聞佛世尊有精進力，廣行惠施，修諸福業，即發無上菩提之願，說伽他曰：「『修無量福求佛果，　　得成善逝自在尊；　　若未能度彼岸者，　　我當誓度令至岸。
translation: Upon hearing that the Bhagavān had the power of effort, had given generosity, and had cultivated meritorious actions, the great king then aroused the vow of unsurpassed enlightenment and spoke to the gods, saying, 'Cultivate measureless merits and seek the Buddha's fruit to become the honored one who passes well and is freely attainable; if I'm unable to reach the other shore, I'll vow to deliver him to that shore.'

source_sentence: 聞佛離欲發菩提，　　復行惠施正法化；　　願我當來得成佛，　　利益有情貪欲滅。』」
translation: After hearing that the Buddha is free of desire and arouses enlightenment, I'll again give generosity and teach the correct dharma; may I become a buddha in the future and help sentient beings to cease their cravings.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the king, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼時名光明王者，豈異人乎？
translation: Was he then called the King of Light? Was he someone else?

source_sentence: 即我身是。
translation: That's who I am.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，初發無上菩提之意。」
translation: At the time, I first aroused the intention for unsurpassed bodhi."

source_sentence: 爾時勝光王復白世尊曰：「最初於誰行施得證無上菩提？」
translation: King Vairocana then again said to the Bhagavān, "Who was the first person to practice generosity and realize unsurpassed bodhi?"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「乃往古昔無量劫時，有城名曰毘訶彼地，其城有一陶輪工師。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Back in the distant past, during an incalculably long eon, there was a city named Vihāpati, and there was a potter in that city.

source_sentence: 有佛出世，號曰釋迦牟尼，證無上正真等正覺，十號具足。
translation: There was a Buddha who appeared in the world named Śākyamuni, who realized unsurpassed true and perfect enlightenment and was replete with the ten epithets.

source_sentence: 亦有聲聞弟子，名舍利弗、大目乾連，及侍者阿難陀。
translation: There were also śrāvaka disciples named Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, and Ānanda, his attendant.

source_sentence: 時釋迦牟尼佛正真等正覺，共無量苾芻眾俱遊行人間，至彼城中。
translation: At the time, Śākyamuni was traveling among the people with an innumerable multitude of monks and nuns and arrived in that city.

source_sentence: 爾時彼佛忽有風患，即告阿難陀曰：『汝可往彼陶輪家乞酥油蜜漿。』
translation: At the time, the Buddha suddenly had a windstorm and told Ānanda, 'Go to that potter's house and ask for butter, oil, and honey jelly.'

source_sentence: 爾時阿難陀聞佛教勅，即往詣陶輪家，在門外立，白言：『長者！
translation: Upon hearing the Buddha's command, Ānanda went to the potter's house, stood outside the door, and said, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 世尊患風強病，今須酥油蜜漿。』
translation: The Bhagavān is suffering from a strong wind condition and now needs ghee and honey.'

source_sentence: 時陶輪師聞具壽阿難陀所說，即將酥油蜜等，長者共兒相隨，俱往佛所，以酥蜜等遍塗佛身，溫水沐浴，持沙糖水奉上世尊，為療病故，即得痊愈。
translation: When the potter heard what Kauśānita had told him, he prepared butter and honey, and an elderly man and his son accompanied him to the Buddha's place, rubbed butter and honey all over his body, bathed him in warm water, and presented him with sugar water to the Bhagavān, for the purpose of healing his illness, and he was instantly healed.

source_sentence: 爾時陶師長跪發願，說伽他曰：「『我以蘇蜜施如來，　　願獲廣大功德利；　　種族名號聲聞眾，　　悉如今日釋迦尊；　　善能調伏有情類，　　遠離眾苦歸圓寂。』
translation: The potter then knelt down and made a vow, saying, 'I will give this tathāgata soothing honey that I may obtain the benefits of vast merit; all the śrāvakas of my clan's name will become the honored Śākyamunis of today; they will be able to skillfully tame sentient beings and return to perfect tranquility, far removed from suffering.'

source_sentence: 「其陶輪子亦發是言：『願我當來如佛侍者。』」
translation: "The potter also spoke this way, saying, 'May I be like the Buddha's attendant in the future.'"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我於爾時，初施釋迦如來，得證無上菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "At the time, I first gave alms to the Tathāgata Śākyamuni and realized unsurpassed bodhi.

source_sentence: 其子者，即阿難陀是。」
translation: That son of his is Ānanda."

source_sentence: 王復問世尊曰：「從初乃至成佛，供養幾許諸佛，而證無上菩提？」
translation: The king then asked the Bhagavān, "From the beginning until he became a buddha, how many buddhas did he support and realize unsurpassed enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「我從釋迦如來最初阿僧企耶，乃至護世佛時，以清淨心，如是供養七萬五千佛，於爾許時供養不曾心異，唯求無上正等菩提。
translation: The Buddha told the king, "From the first incalculable eons of the Śākyas and tathāgatas up to the time of the Protecting Buddha, I have made such offerings to 75,000 buddhas with a pure heart and have never had a different intention than to seek only unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 第二僧企耶，我初供養燃燈佛，乃至寶髻佛，以清淨心，如是供養七萬六千佛。
translation: "Second, Saṃkhya, I first made offerings to the Burning Lamp Buddha and then to the Jewel-topknot Buddha, making such offerings to 76,000 buddhas with a pure heart.

source_sentence: 我雖經歷多生，心無有異，常以清信供養諸佛。
translation: Although I've gone through many lifetimes, my mind hasn't changed, and I've always made offerings to the buddhas with pure faith.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 第三阿僧企耶，初供養寶髻佛，乃至安隱佛。
translation: "In the third incalculable year, they first make offerings to the Jewel-topknot Buddha and then to the Aniruddha Buddha.

source_sentence: 如是供養七萬七千佛，如是又至迦攝波佛。
translation: They thus make offerings to 77,000 buddhas, and so on up to Kāśyapa Buddha.

source_sentence: 我雖供養無有異心，常以淨信供養諸佛。
translation: Although I make offerings without any change of mind, I always make offerings to the buddhas with pure faith.

source_sentence: 為菩薩時如是供養，皆蒙諸佛為我受記，當證無上正等菩提。
translation: When I was a bodhisattva and thus made offerings, I received assurances from the buddhas that I would realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 滿我所願，思求正覺，堅固釋持，慈攝一切有情故。」
translation: Fulfilling my vows, I contemplate seeking right awakening, firmly explaining and maintaining it, and compassionately including all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時勝光王聞佛說已，心大歡喜，頂禮雙足，奉辭而去。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, King Vairocana was overjoyed, bowed his head with both feet, and departed.

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀即以伽陀，請世尊曰：「唯願世間尊，　　為我分別說；　何處初發意？
translation: Kauṣṭhila Ānanda then took this gada and asked the Bhagavān, "May the Bhagavān discern for me where I first got my intention?

source_sentence: 為求大菩提。
translation: "In order to pursue great enlightenment.

source_sentence: 更願無上士，　　為說本事緣，　曾供養幾佛？
translation: May it be the wish of the unsurpassed one to explain this ability as a condition, and how many buddhas has he offered support to?

source_sentence: 復經幾許時？」
translation: How much more time has passed?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以頌答曰：「無上兩足尊，　　慈愍有情者；　於彼發菩提，　　誓度三有海。
translation: The Bhagavān then replied with a verse, "The unsurpassed, two-legged honored one, who has compassion for sentient beings, arouses bodhi there and vows to save the three oceans of existence.

source_sentence: 聞佛心離欲，　　廣說醉象緣；　厭離貪欲習，　　因發菩提心。
translation: He heard the Buddha's mind free of desire, explained extensively the condition of drunkenness and elephants, became free of the habituation of desire, and thus aroused the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 堅固發誓願，　　惠施如河沙；　光明王世時，　　專求正覺等。
translation: He made a firm vow to bestow blessings like the sands of a river; when the King of Light was alive, he focused on seeking perfect enlightenment and so forth.

source_sentence: 初見釋迦佛，　　我作陶輪師；　酥油蜜漿等，　　最初為供養。
translation: When I first saw Śākyamuni Buddha, I became a potter's wheel master, making offerings of butter, oil, and honeydew at first.

source_sentence: 亦曾為上女，　　正信三寶尊；　我見憍陳佛，　　以燈油奉施。
translation: I was once a noble woman who believed in the Three Treasures, and I saw Kauṇḍinya Buddha and offered him oil from a lamp.

source_sentence: 無勝佛世時，　　我曾作三藏；　共大眾相競，　　惡罵僧為女。
translation: When the Buddha was invincible, I once worked as a tripiṭaka; I competed with the crowd and viciously abused the saṃgha as my daughter.

source_sentence: 由斯口惡業，　　變我身為女；　却迴心淨已，　　還變為丈夫。
translation: Because of this bad verbal action, I was transformed into a woman, but after I purified my mind, I was transformed back into a husband.

source_sentence: 乃往過去世，　　曾為王子時；　寶髻佛兄弟，　　我以燈明施。
translation: Once upon a time, when I was a prince in a past life, I gave a candle to the jeweled topknot Buddha as a brother.

source_sentence: 三月曾供養，　　安隱佛世尊；　佛滅度之後，　　以舍利起塔。
translation: For three months, I made offerings to the World Honored One, the Hospitaller Buddha; after he died, I built a stūpa with his relics.

source_sentence: 曾作富長者，　　三月供養佛；　世尊滅度後，　　建塔九十肘。
translation: I was a wealthy man who made offerings to the Buddha for three months; after the Bhagavān passed away, I built a stūpa of ninety elbows.

source_sentence: 後見有勝佛，　　梵志中為最；　舉手合掌敬，　　供養人中尊。
translation: Later, he saw a remarkable Buddha, the foremost among priests, raised his hands together in respect, and offered his offerings to the most honored among men.

source_sentence: 昔時作梵志，　　書論悉明解；　我逢利益佛，　　施座奉如來。
translation: In the past, I was a priest who wrote treatises and comprehended them thoroughly; I met the Beneficent Buddha and offered my seat to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 往修苦行時，　　曾住仙人法；　見憍陳世尊，　　捉身欲山下。
translation: When I was practicing austerities, I once abided in the Dharma of an immortal; I saw the World Honored One, grabbing my body and wanting to go down the mountain.

source_sentence: 我曾作仙人，　　遇逢樂見佛；　諸佛至居處，　　以根菓供養。
translation: I was once an immortal who met the Blissful Vision Buddha and offered offerings with my roots when the buddhas came to my abode.

source_sentence: 往昔作仙人，　　見善眼世尊；　以著樹皮衣，　　持施覆其身。
translation: Once, I was an immortal who saw the World Honored One with Good Eyes, wearing a bark robe, and covered his body with alms.

source_sentence: 昔曾作人王，　　供養勒叉佛；　頓捨四兵眾，　　求無上菩提。
translation: Once he was a human king who made offerings to the Lakṣmī Buddha and suddenly abandoned his four armies to pursue unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 從初釋迦佛，　　至於護世佛；　七萬五千佛，　　我皆盡供養。
translation: From the first Śākyamuni Buddha to the World-protecting Buddha, I've made offerings to all 75,000 buddhas.

source_sentence: 此是一僧祇，　　如是行供養；　一心無異別，　　恒發菩提願。
translation: These are the one incalculable number of buddhas who are thus offered up, unified in mind without distinction, and constantly arousing the vow for enlightenment.

source_sentence: 次見燃燈佛，　　多聞甚可愛；　以七青蓮花，　　作梵志持供。
translation: Next, I saw the Burning Lamp Buddha, a well-versed and desirable Buddha, and made offerings to Brahmā with seven blue lotus flowers.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　見佛名有相；　於佛修行處，　　供養此如來。
translation: I was once a king who saw a Buddha whose name had characteristics and made offerings to this Tathāgata in his place of practice.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名住修；　以妙色珍寶，　　音聲而供養。
translation: I was once a king whose name was Buddha Abiding and Cultivating, and I made offerings to him with marvelously colored treasures and sounds.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　佛號超師子；　我以寶幡蓋，　　供養此如來。
translation: I was once a king of a country where the Buddha's name was Chao Shizi, and I made offerings to this Tathāgata with a jeweled banner.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　佛名安隱日；　王有一千城，　　皆令修供養。
translation: I once was king of a country where the Buddha's name was Aniruddha and the king had a thousand cities that he cultivated and made offerings to.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名梵志；　以浴室香湯，　　依時沐浴佛。
translation: I was once a king, and there was a Buddha named Brahmā; I bathed the Buddha with a bath of scented water and water at regular intervals.

source_sentence: 我昔作國王，　　城中而供養；　三千梵志佛，　　及一尸棄佛。
translation: I was once a king who made offerings to 3,000 Brahmā and one Śikhin Buddha in a city.

source_sentence: 我曾作長者，　　於財增城中；　供二十五佛，　　修行於梵行。
translation: I was an elder who made offerings to twenty-five buddhas in a city with an abundance of wealth and cultivated the religious practice.

source_sentence: 我曾作長者，　　於彼大城中；　供養尸棄佛，　　建立寺舍塔。
translation: I was an elder who was in that great city, making offerings to the Śikhin Buddha and building a temple and stūpa.

source_sentence: 其寺供七佛，　　奉施珍寶具；　及以奴婢等，　　莊宅花園林。
translation: That temple was dedicated to seven buddhas, endowed with treasures, and built a mansion and a garden with slaves and servants.

source_sentence: 曾作王信敬，　　於尸棄佛所；　復在彼城中，　　唯求正等覺。
translation: Once, the king was a believer in Śikhin Buddha, and he stayed in that city, seeking only to attain perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 昔曾作梵志，　　有佛名歡喜；　為求菩提故，　　以果先供養。
translation: Once, when he was a priest, there was a Buddha named Rejoice, and for the sake of seeking enlightenment, he made offerings beforehand with the results.

source_sentence: 曾作長者時，　　有佛名善眼；　我以摩尼寶，　　供養此如來。
translation: Once, when I was an elder, there was a Buddha named Sunetra; with my maṇi treasure, I made offerings to this Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 亦曾作商主，　　有佛名善生；　坐於菩提樹，　　以餅先供養。
translation: Once, when I was a merchant, there was a Buddha named Shangsheng who sat on a bodhi tree and offered up bread as an offering.

source_sentence: 於千商人中，　　曾作千商主；　見佛坐菩提，　　號名善意佛。
translation: Among a thousand merchants, he once was the head of a thousand merchants; he saw the Buddha sitting in bodhi and was called the Good Will Buddha.

source_sentence: 香泥塗佛上，　　復以扇招涼；　佛邊坐聽法，　　聞法心開悟。
translation: He smeared scented clay on the Buddha's head and used a fan to invoke coolness; he sat beside the Buddha and listened to the Dharma, and his mind was enlightened by hearing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 昔作商人主，　　有佛名釋迦；　我以眾寶花，　　以花散佛上。
translation: Once, when I was a merchant owner, there was a Buddha named Śākyamuni; I took many precious flowers and scattered them on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 昔作商人主，　　有佛名高登；　以幡花音樂，　　供養如是佛。
translation: Once, I was a merchant lord, and there was a Buddha named Gautama; I made offerings to such a Buddha with streamers, flowers, music, and sounds.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名最上；　超越諸有海，　　當施眾車輅。
translation: I was once a king, and there was a Buddha named Bhadra; I transcended the seas of existence and gave chariots and carts.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名最尊；　佛行百里內，　　地散諸妙花。
translation: I once was a king, and there was a Buddha named Most Venerable; within a hundred miles of his travels, he scattered marvelous flowers on the ground.

source_sentence: 我於過去世，　　聞佛欲來過；　遠將勝幡蓋，　　并四兵圍遶。
translation: In a past life, I heard that the Buddha wanted to cross over; I gathered a great banner and covered it with four armies to surround it.

source_sentence: 有佛欲渡河，　　我當作舡師；　見佛心歡喜，　　渡佛到彼岸。
translation: When the Buddha wanted to cross the river, I became his boat driver; rejoicing at the sight of the Buddha, I ferried him to the other shore.

source_sentence: 我曾作商主，　　有佛名賢車；　為佛造橋梁，　　令佛安隱渡。
translation: I was once a merchant, and there was a Buddha named Bhadrakapilā; I built a bridge for him and made him cross in safety.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名大梵；　牛頭香造寺，　　以供養於尊。
translation: I was once a king, and there was a Buddha named Brahmā, and I built a temple with oxhead incense to offer to the venerable.

source_sentence: 著僧伽胝衣，　　以覆如來上；　儉世檀香浴，　　降雨人歸佛。
translation: He wore a monk's robe to cover the Tathāgata, bathed himself in the world's sandalwood, and sent rain down on people to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我曾作國王，　　有佛名淨月；　國有多疾疫，　　供佛疫皆除。
translation: Once, when I was king, there was a Buddha named Jñānagupta; there were many illnesses and epidemics in my country, but I offered offerings to the Buddha to remove them all.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名調帝；　請佛說妙法，　　為求菩提道。
translation: When I was king, there was a Buddha named Tady who asked him to teach us the wondrous Dharma in order to pursue the path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名梵尊；　施佛僧伽胝，　　用覆如來上。
translation: When I was king, there was a Buddha named Brahmā who gave alms to the Buddha as a gift to cover the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 當時國中儉，　　我以旃檀湯；　沐浴如來體，　　豐樂人歸佛。
translation: When the country was frugal, I used sandalwood hot water to bathe the Tathāgata's body, and people gave their happiness to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　有佛名帝釋；　其國有災起，　　王發慈止息。
translation: When I was king, there was a Buddha named Tissa; a calamity arose in that country, and the king showed compassion and stopped it.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　供養調帝佛；　用諸百萬寶，　　造食獻如來。
translation: When I was king, I made offerings to the Tathāgata Buddha and used millions of treasures to build food for the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志信，　　見佛名悉達；　以百千頌讚，　　供養天人師。
translation: I used to be a priest and believer who saw the Buddha named Siddhârtha and offered support to gods and humans with a hundred thousand hymns of praise.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志時，　　佛名帝釋幢；　合掌以正信，　　當來願如佛。
translation: When I was a priest, the Buddha's name was Indra's banner; I put my palms together in right faith and vowed to be like the Buddha in the future.

source_sentence: 始從燃燈佛，　　至於帝釋幢；　七萬六千佛，　　我皆盡供養。
translation: From the Dīpaṃkara Buddha to the Banner of Indra, I've made offerings to all 76,000 buddhas.

source_sentence: 滿二阿僧祇，　　供養於諸佛；　不曾心有異，　　志願菩提處。
translation: For two incalculably long [eons], I've made offerings to the buddhas; there's never been a difference in my mind, and I've vowed for the place of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 第三阿僧祇，　　亦為王供養；　佛名安隱日，　　滅度而起塔。
translation: For the third incalculable time, the king also made offerings to a Buddha whose name was Aniruddha, and he erected a stūpa after he died.

source_sentence: 我昔為國王，　　種種供養佛；　滿足皆隨意，　　起塔名法王。
translation: Once, when I was king, I made various offerings to the Buddha; they were all fulfilled as I wished, and I raised a stūpa named Dharma King.

source_sentence: 昔為大商主，　　見佛名悉供；　我以眾金花，　　散佛呈供養。
translation: Once, when I was a great merchant, I made offerings to all who saw the Buddha's name, and I scattered offerings to the Buddha with a profusion of gold flowers.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名寶髻；　為佛作金網，　　以覆大師上。
translation: When I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha's name Jewel-topknot and made a gold net for him to wrap around the great master.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　佛名上蓮花；　作銀花供養，　　散布如來上。
translation: In the past, when I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha's name as the superior lotus; I made an offering of silver flowers and scattered them over the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名上稱；　我以上妙室，　　供養於如來。
translation: In the past, when I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha's name, Shangchengcheng; I made offerings to the Tathāgata from my high and mighty abode.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　佛號名勝論；　正證菩提日，　　我以四兵護。
translation: Once upon a time, I was the king of a great country, and the Buddha's name was Vaiśeṣika-śāstra; on the day I correctly realized enlightenment, I protected him with four armies.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名無垢；　造塔并浴室，　　及以燃燈明。
translation: When I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha's name as Vimalakīrti, built a stūpa and bath, and lit a lamp.

source_sentence: 我昔作王時，　　見佛名合覺；　坐石而入定，　　音樂以供養。
translation: When I was king, I saw the Buddha's name, Hopewell; I sat on a rock, concentrated, and made offerings with music.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　見佛名修行；　降怨度人眾，　　掃地令佛過。
translation: When I was a merchant, I saw the Buddha's name Cultivation; I subdued enemies and saved people, and I swept the floor to make the Buddha pass.

source_sentence: 昔為商人時，　　聞佛名淨住；　欲來造寺舍，　　園苑毘訶羅。
translation: When he was a merchant, he heard the Buddha's name purify his abode; he wanted to build a monastery or garden, or vaihāra, in the park.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名相師；　摩尼寶供養，　　我時為菩薩。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a great king whose Buddha was called Xiang Shi; he made offerings of maṇi treasures, and I was a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名繫都；　我造法王塔，　　繒幡以供養。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a great king whose Buddha's name was Tuṣita; I built a stūpa for the Dharma king and offered offerings with silken banners.

source_sentence: 昔為大國王，　　有佛名捨重；　我以瓶杖施，　　起塔并設會。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a great king named Śākyamuni, and I gave a gift of a bottle and staff, erected a stūpa, and set up an assembly.

source_sentence: 我昔為商主，　　有佛名見義；　以金寶真珠，　　種種香供養。
translation: I was a merchant lord once, and there was a Buddha named Vision; I offered various kinds of gold, jewels, and genuine pearls as incense.

source_sentence: 我為大國王，　　佛名諸兵義；　佛遊於人間，　　四兵迎供養。
translation: I was the king of a great country, and the Buddha's name was Soldiers' Meaning; the Buddha traveled among people, and four soldiers welcomed and made offerings.

source_sentence: 我為大國王，　　佛名他利見；　欲入於城內，　　設樂香花供。
translation: I am a great king, and the Buddha's name is Other-Like-Viewing; I want to enter the city and make offerings of music, incense, and flowers.

source_sentence: 我昔為商主，　　有佛名底沙；　以諸莖木香，　　根香散供佛。
translation: Once, when I was a merchant, there was a Buddha named Tiṣya who used to scatter fragrances from stalks and roots as offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「我昔曾為大仙人，　　見晨宿佛在寶龕；　但一伽他而讚佛，　　超過九劫修苦行。
translation: "Once, I was a great sage who saw the morning sleeper Buddha in a jeweled shrine; but I praised him as a monk who had cultivated austerities for more than nine eons.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志名最上，　　見佛名曰毘婆尸；　兩手持苣發菩提，　　歡喜布散如來上。
translation: Once, I was a priest named Most Excellent, and I saw the Buddha named Vipaśyin; holding a chicory in my hand, I aroused bodhi and joyfully scattered it above the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 菩薩昔為商主時，　　見佛世尊名尸棄；　并有弟子聲聞眾，　　三月衣食而供給。
translation: When he was a merchant, the bodhisattva saw the Bhagavān named Śikhin and had a multitude of disciples and śrāvakas who provided food and clothing for him in three months.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　於彼毘婆尸佛所；　并諸弟子聲聞眾，　　三月衣食而供給。
translation: In the past, he was a merchant with deep and correct faith who went to that Vipaśyin Buddha's place and had a multitude of disciples and śrāvakas who provided food and clothing for three months.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　佛名迦留村陀佛；　請佛家資盡布施，　　隨佛出家持梵行。
translation: In the past, that merchant had deep and genuine faith that the Buddha's name was Kālúcunda Buddha; he asked his family to contribute all their assets and followed him out of the house to maintain the religious practice.

source_sentence: 昔為商人深正信，　　見佛迦耶迦牟尼；　先造立寺生恭敬，　　後乃方隨佛出家。
translation: In the past, a merchant of deep and correct faith saw the Buddha Kātyāyaka Muni; he first built a temple and venerated it, then followed him into homelessness.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志名最勝，　　於兩足尊迦葉佛；　由聞喜護所說語，　　乃得出家修淨意。
translation: Once, a priest named Most Excellent honored the Buddha Kāśyapa with two legs; because he heard what Xihui taught, he left home and cultivated pure intentions.

source_sentence: 菩薩昔作國王時，　　於彌勒仙修供養；　入定見我當作佛，　　時仙却來供養我。
translation: When he was king, the bodhisattva cultivated offerings to the Maitreya sage; when he entered into meditation and saw me as a Buddha, the sage came back to make offerings to me.

source_sentence: 從安隱佛至迦葉，　　供養七萬七千佛；　一切如來皆奉侍，　　乃能數滿三僧祇。
translation: From Ānanda Buddha to Kāśyapa, he made offerings to 77,000 buddhas; all of them were served by the tathāgatas, and they could then be counted among the three incalculable eons.

source_sentence: 皆悉歡喜而供事，　　未曾少許心別異；　皆發無上菩提願，　　為菩薩時供養佛。
translation: They all rejoice and make offerings, not even slightly discriminating their minds; they all give rise to the vow of unsurpassed enlightenment and make offerings to the buddhas when they're bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 一切示現而授記，　　對眾咸言當作佛；　我先求願皆滿足，　　如先所願今思忖。
translation: They all show up and are given a prediction, and they all say to the others, 'I will become a buddha.' They fulfill all of my vows, just as I had vowed before and now I'm considering it.

source_sentence: 此願皆令得滿足，　　彼佛世尊諸大德；　授我無上菩提記。
translation: Having fulfilled all of these vows, the Bhagavān, the honored ones, and the great virtues granted me the record of unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我昔曾作尸毘王，　復為一切施主時，　　并及尾濫大王身，　捨身捨寶行檀度。
translation: Once upon a time, when I was King Śibi and was the donor of all gifts, I and the great King Miliṇḍa gave up my body and my treasures to practice altar worship.

source_sentence: 昔為商主入大海，　持戒專求趣彼岸，　　能害自身令眾樂，　皆令得度於苦海。
translation: Once, I was a merchant entering the ocean, upholding precepts and focusing on the other shore, harming myself and making others happy, so that they could all cross the ocean of suffering.

source_sentence: 往昔曾作仙人時，　常行忍辱波羅蜜，　　身體手足被支解，　由行忍辱心無退，　　如緊那羅本生說。
translation: Once, when I was an immortal, I always practiced the perfection of patience, dismembering my body, hands, and feet, so that my mind didn't falter as I practiced patience, just like the native teachings of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 我曾欲竭於大海，　　以滿精進波羅蜜，　皆由口業真實語。
translation: "I once wanted to dry up the ocean to fulfill the perfection of effort, and it was all because of my true words of verbal action.

source_sentence: 昔名藥物大臣時，　牛出梵志共論義，　　當滿般若波羅蜜，　諸天擊鼓而助喜。
translation: In the past, when I was known as the minister of medicines, a cow produced a priest who shared a discussion about the meaning, and when it was filled with the perfection of prajñā, the gods beat their drums to rejoice.

source_sentence: 昔為梵志名生然，　勤修勝禪波羅蜜，　　頭上鳥生男女卵，　定中不起鳥能飛。
translation: Once, when he was a priest named Sengran, he diligently cultivated the perfection of meditation, and a bird on his head produced eggs of both sexes, and the bird could fly without rising from meditation.

source_sentence: 修行滿六波羅蜜，　慈心常有思念處，　　我廣心求尊重願，　發願願求皆滿足。
translation: When he cultivated the perfection of six perfections, his compassionate mind always had a place of contemplation, and I sought with great diligence to honor his vows and have all of his vows and requests fulfilled.

source_sentence: 彼諸大德一切佛，　我皆供養天人師，　　三有苦海諸眾生，　一切皆歸涅槃路，　　我為菩薩修供養。
translation: I've made offerings to all those great buddhas, gods, humans, and teachers, and I've cultivated offerings for bodhisattvas to all the sentient beings in the three oceans of suffering who have all returned to the path to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 從彼光明王身後，　　乃至帝幢佛世尊；　度得一千俱胝眾，　　況復成佛度無邊。
translation: From the body of that King of Light up to the Bhagavān, the Bhagavān has saved a thousand calluses, how much more will he save an infinite number of buddhas?

source_sentence: 世間之尊大導師，　　已度未度人天眾；　我已置立橋船筏，　　堅固度於諸有情。
translation: I've built a bridge and a raft, and I've resolutely saved all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　由能濟度無邊人，　諸有能修福德者，　　當來皆入涅槃城。
translation: After I enter into perfect extinction, I'll be able to save an unlimited number of people, and all those who cultivate merit will enter the city of nirvāṇa in the future.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　而能修集於佛事，　少許供養於形像，　　即得生天無量樂。
translation: If I were to enter into perfect tranquility and then cultivate the Buddha's works and make a few offerings to his image, I'd attain birth in the heavens with measureless bliss.

source_sentence: 我若入於圓寂後，　　遺留法寶甘露味，　如若有情聞此者，　　皆能修習出離去。」
translation: If I were to leave behind the taste of the Dharma treasure's ambrosia after I enter into perfect extinction, then if any sentient being hears this, they'll all be able to cultivate escape."

source_sentence: 已上諸佛名。
translation: These are the names of the buddhas mentioned above.
